Part 1
You must answer this question.
You recently spent two days at an annual international arts festival. Most of the events you went to were good, but you feel that the festival could be even better next year.
Read the advertisement for the festival below, on which you have made some notes. Then write a letter to the organiser, Jane Clark, giving your opinions and making at least one suggestion for next year's festival.
International Arts Festival Great idea!
21 - 22 November
Stars and artists from around the world From only six countries
Jazz, rock and classical concerts Some concert halls too small
Plays and films More next year?
Dance shows
Art exhibitions
Talks by writers
One reasonably-priced weekend ticket for all events Excellent Because...
Write a letter of between 120 and 180 words in an appropriate style on the opposite page. Do not write any postal addresses.
Part 2
Write an answer to one of the questions 2 - 5 in this part. Write your answer in 120 - 180 words in an appropriate style on the opposite page. Put the question number in the box at the top of page 5.
You see the following notice in a student magazine.
INDEPENDENT STUDENT MAGAZINE MONEY --- MONEY --- MONEY Everybody wants to earn a bit of money. But how?
We are looking for articles on good ways for young people to earn some money in their spare time. What suggestions do you have? We will publish the best article next month.
Write your article.
The editor of an international magazine is going to publish a special issue with the title Traditional Folk Stories of the World. You have decided to write a story from your country. The story must end with the following words:
This story happened a long time ago.
Write your story.
This is part of a letter which you receive from an English pen friend.
In our class, we've been talking about rules, both at home and at school. I'd be really interested to hear about school rules in your country and also what you are (and aren't) allowed to do at home. Is there anything you'd like to change?
Write the letter to your pen friend. Do not write any postal addresses.

Either
Which do you prefer, stories that are realistic, or ones that are unusual in some way? Write a composition for your teacher, saying which you prefer and why, with reference to the book or one of the short stories you have read.
Or
Characters in books usually have to make choices. Write an article for your school magazine about a choice one of the characters had to make in the book or one of the short stories you have read. You should also say whether you would have made the same choice as the character.
